radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is mildly echogenic, which may reflect fatty deposition. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. The common duct measures 4 mm. The gallbladder is tensely distended without mural edema or pericholecystic fluid. Two gallstones are seen measuring up to 1.7 cm. One may be impacted in the gallbladder neck.
